observation: I see a sign-up page for Deriv with a residence selection step. There's a language selection overlay open that I need to close first. I can see the close button (X) in the top right corner of the overlay. I also notice there are country/region fields and a Next button visible, but I should close this language overlay first to proceed properly.
reasoning: As a normal user, I need to close this language selection overlay that's blocking the main sign-up form. The close button (X) is clearly visible and this is the logical next step to continue with the registration process.
ux_issues: Language overlay appears to be persistent and requires multiple close attempts
Multiple overlapping language selection interfaces are confusing

outcome.visual_observation: The language overlay with dashed border outline around language selector and other UI elements has been removed. The interface now shows a clean sign-up flow with the residence selection form clearly visible without any overlay distractions.
